function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Insufficient consideration of human behavior and social dynamics in the designed physical spaces, leading to non-compliance with social distancing measures.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependence on computational tools for disease tracking and analysis","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of computational solutions for social distancing enhanced optimal design of physical spaces","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dynamic nature of space planning due to covid-19 pandemic","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Manually intervened, ad-hoc solutions for space planning","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Computer-based solutions for covid-19 management","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to sars-cov-2 in hospital environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Efficacy of social distancing and ventilation in preventing the transmission of covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Balancing the need for safe physical distance and efficient medium of interaction for communication","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation systems increasing the risk of airborne pathogen transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate design of public spaces increasing the risk of disease transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of accessibility to green areas for residents with low socioeconomic status","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influence of gender and number of children on access to green areas","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Discrepancy in use of specific green areas by urban and rural residents","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Correlation between socioeconomic status and access to green areas","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changes in access to green areas due to the pandemic","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inequities and exclusions in access to green areas during the pandemic","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Socioeconomic attributes influencing frequency of visiting green areas","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Environmental contexts having a weaker influence on visiting green areas than socioeconomic attributes","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Income level becoming a factor that influences the use of green areas","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for environmental context in relation to frequency of visiting green areas may lead to skewed results and ineffective policies.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Visits to agricultural lands by older individuals outside of urban areas increases risk of contagious disease spread.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Visits to gardens by individuals residing in non-urbanized areas increases risk of contagious disease spread.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Visits to parks by younger individuals in urban areas increases risk of contagious disease spread.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Influence of personal attributes and environmental contexts on the use of green areas","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased visits to green areas by households with children","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influence of household income on visits to green areas","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influence of personal attributes on visits to green areas","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High density urban area nagoya city may contribute to increased risk of contagious diseases due to close proximity and high population density.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of green areas may affect the spread of contagious diseases, especially if crowded or frequented by a large number of people.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Conducting an in-person questionnaire survey during the covid-19 emergency period","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High frequency of visits to green areas during the covid-19 emergency period","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of high-resolution land use data for environmental context analysis","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of detailed analysis on the attributes of green area visitors","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unexplored influence of socioeconomic attributes and environmental contexts on green space access","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of data on the status of access and use of green areas during the covid-19 crisis","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Change in use of green areas due to covid-19 restrictions","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Confusion and disputes regarding lockdown measures in public parks","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reporting of crowded parks leading to unnecessary police intervention","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited accessibility to green areas based on socioeconomic status and environmental context","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inequitable access to green areas based on social attributes such as age, gender, and household composition","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of quantitative evidence for the ubpi technique","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulty in measuring ubpi quantitatively due to the variety of client issues and theoretical backgrounds of psychological skills","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential bias and limitations in self-reported improvement scale as a quantitative measure for ubpi","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential for wider adoption of ubpi in healthcare","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of ubpi in limited resource settings","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of web-based platform for pfa during covid-19","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Taskshifting uc-19 skills to pre-clinical medical students","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased levels of anxiety in students due to movement restriction order","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Breaching confidentiality in telepsychiatry consultations","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
